next_steps.note: "Define the scope of 'focus poetry'. What sub-genres, themes, or forms will be prioritized (e.g., haiku, free verse, nature, love)?",
"Research and compile a small collection (5-10 poems) of existing 'focus poetry' examples to serve as inspiration and establish a baseline.",
"Brainstorm potential themes or prompts for original 'focus poetry' creation. Add these to the 'Ideas' list.",
"Create a 'Progress' tracking system - outline what constitutes 'completion' for the project (e.g., number of poems written, style established, collection size).",
"Start drafting the first 'focus poem' based on one of the brainstormed themes/prompts. Document any challenges in the 'Issues' list."
"Define specific 'focus' themes for the poetry (e.g., nature, loss, city life) to narrow the project scope and guide content creation.",
"Brainstorm at least 10 potential poem titles or starting lines based on the chosen 'focus' themes; add these to the 'Ideas' list.",
"Draft the first complete poem, focusing on adhering to a chosen poetic form (e.g., haiku, sonnet, free verse) to establish a baseline for style.",
"Review the '9 next steps pending' list and prioritize the top 3 based on dependency and ease of completion; document the revised list.",
"Identify 3 poets whose work exemplifies 'focus' and 'form' and analyze one poem from each for structural and thematic elements; add insights to 'Ideas'."
